name: src/core/Disposable.js
Disposable
description:
The Disposable contract.

Implemented by objects that can free internal resources.

name: dispose
description: Frees internal resources.

name: src/core/EffectComposer.js
EffectComposer
description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

The auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer will be disabled to prevent
unnecessary clear operations.

It is common practice to use a {@link RenderPass} as the first pass to
automatically clear the screen and render the scene to a texture for further
processing.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new effect composer.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer that should be used.

params.name: options
params.description: The options.

params.name: options.depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a depth buffer.

params.name: options.stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: options.depthTexture
params.description: Set to true if one of your passes relies on a depth texture.

name: renderer
description:
The renderer.

You may replace the renderer at any time by using
{@link EffectComposer#replaceRenderer}.

name: inputBuffer
description:
The input buffer.

Reading from and writing to the same render target should be avoided.
Therefore, two seperate yet identical buffers are used.

name: outputBuffer
description: The output buffer.

name: copyPass
description: A copy pass used for copying masked scenes.

name: passes
description: The passes.

name: depthTexture
description: The depth texture of the input and output buffers.

name: depthTexture
description:
The input and output buffers share a single depth texture. Depth will be
written to this texture when something is rendered into one of the buffers
and the involved materials have depth write enabled.

You may enable this mechanism during the instantiation of the composer or
by assigning a DepthTexture instance later on. You may also disable it by
assigning null.

name: replaceRenderer
description:
Replaces the current renderer with the given one. The DOM element of the
current renderer will automatically be removed from its parent node and the
DOM element of the new renderer will take its place.

The auto clear mechanism of the provided renderer will be disabled.

Switching between renderers allows you to dynamically enable or disable
antialiasing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The new renderer.

name: createBuffer
description:
Creates a new render target by replicating the renderer's canvas.

The created render target uses a linear filter for texel minification and
magnification. Its render texture format depends on whether the renderer
uses the alpha channel. Mipmaps are disabled.

params.name: depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a depth buffer.

params.name: stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: depthTexture
params.description: Whether the render target should have a depth texture.

return.description: A new render target that equals the renderer's canvas.

name: addPass
description: Adds a pass, optionally at a specific index.

params.name: pass
params.description: A new pass.

params.name: index
params.description: An index at which the pass should be inserted.

name: removePass
description: Removes a pass.

params.name: pass
params.description: The pass.

name: render
description: Renders all enabled passes in the order in which they were added.

params.name: delta
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

name: setSize
description:
Sets the size of the buffers and the renderer's output canvas.

Every pass will be informed of the new size. It's up to each pass how that
information is used.

If no width or height is specified, the render targets and passes will be
updated with the current size of the renderer.

params.name: width
params.description: The width.

params.name: height
params.description: The height.

name: reset
description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.

name: dispose
description:
Destroys this composer and all passes.

This method deallocates all disposable objects created by the passes. It
also deletes the main frame buffers of this composer.

name: src/core/index.js
src/core/Resizable.js
Resizable
description:
The Resizable contract.

Implemented by objects that can be resized.

name: setSize
description: Sets the size of this object.

params.name: width
params.description: The new width.

params.name: height
params.description: The new height.

name: src/index.js
content:
/**
 * Exposure of the library components.
 *
 * @module postprocessing
 */

export {
	Disposable,
	EffectComposer,
	Resizable
} from "./core";

export {
	BloomPass,
	BlurPass,
	BokehPass,
	ClearPass,
	ClearMaskPass,
	DotScreenPass,
	FilmPass,
	GlitchMode,
	GlitchPass,
	GodRaysPass,
	MaskPass,
	OutlinePass,
	Pass,
	PixelationPass,
	RealisticBokehPass,
	RenderPass,
	SavePass,
	ShaderPass,
	ShockWavePass,
	SMAAPass,
	TexturePass,
	ToneMappingPass
} from "./passes";

export {
	AdaptiveLuminosityMaterial,
	BokehMaterial,
	ColorEdgesMaterial,
	CombineMaterial,
	ConvolutionMaterial,
	CopyMaterial,
	DepthComparisonMaterial,
	DotScreenMaterial,
	FilmMaterial,
	GlitchMaterial,
	GodRaysMaterial,
	KernelSize,
	LuminosityMaterial,
	OutlineBlendMaterial,
	OutlineEdgesMaterial,
	PixelationMaterial,
	RealisticBokehMaterial,
	ShockWaveMaterial,
	SMAABlendMaterial,
	SMAAWeightsMaterial,
	ToneMappingMaterial
} from "./materials";

export {
	RawImageData,
	SMAAAreaImageData,
	SMAASearchImageData
} from "./materials/images";

name: src/materials/AdaptiveLuminosityMaterial.js
AdaptiveLuminosityMaterial
description: An adaptive luminosity shader material.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new adaptive luminosity material.

name: src/materials/BokehMaterial.js
BokehMaterial
description:
Depth of Field shader (Bokeh).

Original shader code by Martins Upitis:
 http://artmartinsh.blogspot.com/2010/02/glsl-lens-blur-filter-with-bokeh.html

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new bokeh material.

params.name: camera
params.description: A camera.

params.name: options
params.description: The options.

params.name: options.focus
params.description: The focus distance, corresponds directly with the scene depth.

params.name: options.dof
params.description: Depth of field. An area in front of and behind the focus point that still appears sharp.

params.name: options.aperture
params.description: Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for stronger blur and shallower depth of field.

params.name: options.maxBlur
params.description: Maximum blur strength.

name: adoptCameraSettings
description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.

params.name: camera
params.description: A camera.

name: src/materials/ColorEdgesMaterial.js
ColorEdgesMaterial
description:
A material that detects edges in a color texture.

Mainly used for Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new color edges material.

params.name: texelSize
params.description: The absolute screen texel size.

name: setEdgeDetectionThreshold
description:
Sets the edge detection sensitivity.

A lower value results in more edges being detected at the expense of
performance.

0.1 is a reasonable value, and allows to catch most visible edges.
0.05 is a rather overkill value, that allows to catch 'em all.

If temporal supersampling is used, 0.2 could be a reasonable value,
as low contrast edges are properly filtered by just 2x.

params.name: threshold
params.description: The edge detection sensitivity. Range: [0, 0.5].

name: src/materials/CombineMaterial.js
CombineMaterial
description:
A material for combining two textures.

This material supports the two blend modes Add and Screen.

In Screen mode, the two textures are effectively projected on a white screen
simultaneously. In Add mode, the textures are simply added together which
often produces undesired, washed out results.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new combine material.

params.name: screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used.

name: setScreenModeEnabled
description: Enables or disables the Screen blend mode.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the Screen blend mode should be enabled.

name: src/materials/ConvolutionMaterial.js
ConvolutionMaterial
description:
An optimised convolution shader material.

This material supports dithering.

Based on the GDC2003 Presentation by Masaki Kawase, Bunkasha Games:
 Frame Buffer Postprocessing Effects in DOUBLE-S.T.E.A.L (Wreckless)
and an article by Filip Strugar, Intel:
 An investigation of fast real-time GPU-based image blur algorithms

Further modified according to Apple's
[Best Practices for Shaders](https://goo.gl/lmRoM5).

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new convolution material.

params.name: texelSize
params.description: The absolute screen texel size.

name: kernelSize
description: The current kernel size.

name: getKernel
description: Returns the kernel.

name: setTexelSize
description: Sets the texel size.

params.name: x
params.description: The texel width.

params.name: y
params.description: The texel height.

name: kernelPresets
description: The Kawase blur kernel presets.

name: KernelSize
description: A kernel size enumeration.

properties.name: VERY_SMALL
properties.description: A very small kernel that matches a 7x7 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: SMALL
properties.description: A small kernel that matches a 15x15 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: MEDIUM
properties.description: A medium sized kernel that matches a 23x23 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: LARGE
properties.description: A large kernel that matches a 35x35 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: VERY_LARGE
properties.description: A very large kernel that matches a 63x63 Gauss blur kernel.

properties.name: HUGE
properties.description: A huge kernel that matches a 127x127 Gauss blur kernel.

name: src/materials/CopyMaterial.js
CopyMaterial
description: A simple copy shader material.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new copy material.

name: src/materials/DepthComparisonMaterial.js
DepthComparisonMaterial
description: A depth comparison shader material.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new depth comparison material.

params.name: depthTexture
params.description: A depth texture.

params.name: camera
params.description: A camera.

name: adoptCameraSettings
description: Adopts the settings of the given camera.

params.name: camera
params.description: A camera.

name: src/materials/DotScreenMaterial.js
DotScreenMaterial
description: A dot screen shader material.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new dot screen material.

params.name: options
params.description: The options.

params.name: options.average
params.description: Whether the shader should output the colour average (black and white).

params.name: options.angle
params.description: The angle of the dot pattern.

params.name: options.scale
params.description: The scale of the dot pattern.

params.name: options.intensity
params.description: The intensity of the effect.

name: setAverageEnabled
description: Enables or disables the Screen blend mode.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the Screen blend mode should be enabled.

name: src/materials/FilmMaterial.js
FilmMaterial
description:
A cinematic shader that provides the following effects:
 - Film Grain
 - Scanlines
 - Vignette
 - Greyscale
 - Sepia

Original scanlines algorithm by Pat "Hawthorne" Shearon.
 http://www.truevision3d.com/forums/showcase/staticnoise_colorblackwhite_scanline_shaders-t18698.0.html

Optimised scanlines and noise with intensity scaling by Georg "Leviathan"
Steinrohder. This version was provided under a Creative Commons Attribution
3.0 License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0.

The sepia effect is based on:
 https://github.com/evanw/glfx.js

The vignette code is based on PaintEffect postprocess from ro.me:
 http://code.google.com/p/3-dreams-of-black/source/browse/deploy/js/effects/PaintEffect.js

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new film material.

params.name: options
params.description: The options. Disabled effects will not be included in the final shader and have no negative impact on performance.

params.name: options.greyscale
params.description: Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.sepia
params.description: Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

params.name: options.vignette
params.description: Apply vignette effect.

params.name: options.eskil
params.description: Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks burned out.

params.name: options.screenMode
params.description: Whether the screen blend mode should be used for noise and scanlines. Both of these effects are computed independently.

params.name: options.noise
params.description: Show noise-based film grain.

params.name: options.scanlines
params.description: Show scanlines.

params.name: options.grid
params.description: Show a grid.

params.name: options.noiseIntensity
params.description: The noise intensity.

params.name: options.scanlineIntensity
params.description: The scanline intensity.

params.name: options.gridIntensity
params.description: The grid strength. 0.0 to 1.0.

params.name: options.greyscaleIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the greyscale effect. 0.0 to 1.0.

params.name: options.sepiaIntensity
params.description: The intensity of the sepia effect. 0.0 to 1.0.

params.name: options.vignetteOffset
params.description: The offset of the vignette effect. 0.0 to 1.0.

params.name: options.vignetteDarkness
params.description: The darkness of the vignette effect. 0.0 to 1.0.

name: setScreenModeEnabled
description: Enables or disables the Screen blend mode.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the Screen blend mode should be enabled.

name: setNoiseEnabled
description: Enables or disables the noise effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the noise effect should be enabled.

name: setScanlinesEnabled
description: Enables or disables the scanlines effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the scanlines effect should be enabled.

name: setGridEnabled
description: Enables or disables the grid effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the grid effect should be enabled.

name: setGreyscaleEnabled
description: Enables or disables the greyscale effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the greyscale effect should be enabled.

name: setSepiaEnabled
description: Enables or disables the sepia effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the sepia effect should be enabled.

name: setVignetteEnabled
description: Enables or disables the Vignette effect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the Vignette effect should be enabled.

name: setEskilEnabled
description:
Enables or disables the Eskil Vignette effect.

Has no effect if Vignette is disabled.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the Eskil Vignette effect should be enabled.

name: src/materials/GlitchMaterial.js
GlitchMaterial
description:
A glitch shader material.

Reference:
 https://github.com/staffantan/unityglitch

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new glitch material.

name: src/materials/GodRaysMaterial.js
GodRaysMaterial
description:
A crepuscular rays shader material.

This material supports dithering.

References:

Thibaut Despoulain, 2012:
 [(WebGL) Volumetric Light Approximation in Three.js](
 http://bkcore.com/blog/3d/webgl-three-js-volumetric-light-godrays.html)

Nvidia, GPU Gems 3, 2008:
 [Chapter 13. Volumetric Light Scattering as a Post-Process](
 https://developer.nvidia.com/gpugems/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch13.html)

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new god rays material.

params.name: options
params.description: The options.

params.name: options.density
params.description: The density of the light rays.

params.name: options.decay
params.description: An illumination decay factor.

params.name: options.weight
params.description: A light ray weight factor.

params.name: options.exposure
params.description: A constant attenuation coefficient.

params.name: options.clampMax
params.description: An upper bound for the saturation of the overall effect.

return.description: The canvas or null if it couldn't be created.

name: src/materials/images/smaa/areaImageDataURL.js
content:
// Generated with SMAAAreaImageData.generate().toCanvas().toDataURL().
export default "data:image/png;base64,";

name: src/materials/images/smaa/searchImageDataURL.js
content:
// Generated with SMAASearchImageData.generate().toCanvas().toDataURL(), not cropped, low dynamic range.
export default "data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAEIAAAAhCAAAAABIXyLAAAAAOElEQVRIx2NgGAWjYBSMglEwEICREYRgFBZBqDCSLA2MGPUIVQETE9iNUAqLR5gIeoQKRgwXjwAAGn4AtaFeYLEAAAAASUVORK5CYII";

name: src/materials/images/smaa/utils/SMAAAreaImageData.js
b0
description: A box.

name: b1
description: A box.

name: ORTHOGONAL_SIZE
description: The orthogonal texture size.

name: DIAGONAL_SIZE
description: The diagonal texture size.

name: DIAGONAL_SAMPLES
description:
The number of samples for calculating areas in the diagonal textures.
Diagonal areas are calculated using brute force sampling.

name: SMOOTH_MAX_DISTANCE
description: The maximum distance for smoothing U-shapes.

name: orthogonalSubsamplingOffsets
description: Subsampling offsets for orthogonal areas.

name: diagonalSubsamplingOffsets
description: Subsampling offset pairs for diagonal areas.

name: orthogonalEdges
description:
Orthogonal pattern positioning coordinates.

Used for placing each pattern subtexture into a specific spot.

name: diagonalEdges
description:
Diagonal pattern positioning coordinates.

Used for placing each pattern subtexture into a specific spot.

name: lerp
description: Linearly interpolates between two values.

params.name: a
params.description: The initial value.

params.name: b
params.description: The target value.

params.name: p
params.description: The interpolation value.

name: saturate
description: Clamps a value to the range [0, 1].

params.name: a
params.description: The value.

name: smoothArea
description: A smoothing function for small U-patterns.

params.name: d
params.description: A smoothing factor.

params.name: b
params.description: The area that should be smoothed.

name: calculateOrthogonalArea
description: Calculates the area under the line p1 -> p2, for the pixels (x, x + 1).

params.name: p1
params.description: The starting point of the line.

params.name: p2
params.description: The ending point of the line.

params.name: x
params.description: The pixel index.

params.name: result
params.description: A target vector to store the area in.

name: calculateOrthogonalAreaForPattern
description:
Calculates the area for a given pattern and distances to the left and to the
right, biased by an offset.

params.name: pattern
params.description: A pattern index.

params.name: left
params.description: The left distance.

params.name: right
params.description: The right distance.

params.name: offset
params.description: An offset.

params.name: result
params.description: A target vector to store the area in.

name: isInsideArea
description: Determines whether the given pixel is inside the specified area.

params.name: p1
params.description: The lower bounds of the area.

params.name: p2
params.description: The upper bounds of the area.

params.name: x
params.description: The X-coordinates.

params.name: y
params.description: The Y-coordinates.

return.description: Whether the pixel lies inside the area.

name: calculateDiagonalAreaForPixel
description:
Calculates the area under the line p1 -> p2 for the pixel p using brute force
sampling.

params.name: p1
params.description: The lower bounds of the area.

params.name: p2
params.description: The upper bounds of the area.

params.name: pX
params.description: The X-coordinates.

params.name: pY
params.description: The Y-coordinates.

params.name: result
params.description: A target vector to store the area in.

return.description: The amount of pixels inside the area relative to the total amount of sampled pixels.

name: calculateDiagonalArea
description:
Calculates the area under the line p1 -> p2. This includes the pixel and its
opposite.

params.name: pattern
params.description: A pattern index.

params.name: p1
params.description: The lower bounds of the area.

params.name: p2
params.description: The upper bounds of the area.

params.name: left
params.description: The left distance.

params.name: offset
params.description: An offset.

params.name: result
params.description: A target vector to store the area in.

name: calculateDiagonalAreaForPattern
description:
Calculates the area for a given pattern and distances to the left and to the
right, biased by an offset.

params.name: pattern
params.description: A pattern index.

params.name: left
params.description: The left distance.

params.name: right
params.description: The right distance.

params.name: offset
params.description: An offset.

params.name: result
params.description: A target vector to store the area in.

name: generatePatterns
description: Calculates orthogonal or diagonal patterns for a given offset.

params.name: patterns
params.description: The patterns to assemble.

params.name: offset
params.description: A pattern offset. Diagonal offsets are pairs.

params.name: orthogonal
params.description: Whether the patterns are orthogonal or diagonal.

name: assemble
description: Assembles orthogonal or diagonal patterns into the final area image.

params.name: base
params.description: A base position.

params.name: patterns
params.description: The patterns to assemble.

params.name: edges
params.description: Edge coordinate pairs, used for positioning.

params.name: size
params.description: The pattern size.

params.name: orthogonal
params.description: Whether the patterns are orthogonal or diagonal.

params.name: target
params.description: The target image data.

name: SMAAAreaImageData
description:
SMAA area image data.

This texture allows to obtain the area for a certain pattern and distances
to the left and to the right of the identified line.

Based on the official python scripts:
 https://github.com/iryoku/smaa/tree/master/Scripts

name: generate
description: Creates a new area image.

name: src/materials/images/smaa/utils/SMAASearchImageData.js
edges
description:
This dictionary returns which edges are active for a certain bilinear fetch:
it's the reverse lookup of the bilinear function.

name: lerp
description: Linearly interpolates between two values.

params.name: a
params.description: The initial value.

params.name: b
params.description: The target value.

params.name: p
params.description: The interpolation value.

name: bilinear
description:
Calculates the bilinear fetch for a certain edge combination.

    e[0]       e[1]

             x <-------- Sample Position: (-0.25, -0.125)
    e[2]       e[3] <--- Current Pixel [3]: (0.0, 0.0)

params.name: e
params.description: The edge combination.

name: deltaLeft
description: Computes the delta distance to add in the last step of searches to the left.

params.name: left
params.description: The left edge combination.

params.name: top
params.description: The top edge combination.

name: deltaRight
description: Computes the delta distance to add in the last step of searches to the right.

params.name: left
params.description: The left edge combination.

params.name: top
params.description: The top edge combination.

name: SMAASearchImageData
description:
SMAA search image data.

This image stores information about how many pixels the line search
algorithm must advance in the last step.

Based on the official python scripts:
 https://github.com/iryoku/smaa/tree/master/Scripts

name: generate
description: Creates a new search image.

name: src/materials/index.js
src/materials/LuminosityMaterial.js
LuminosityMaterial
description:
A luminosity shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map that describes the absolute
amount of light emitted by a scene. It can also be configured to output
colours that are scaled with their respective luminance value. Additionally,
a range may be provided to mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel will remain unaffected in all cases.

On luminance coefficients:
 http://www.poynton.com/notes/colour_and_gamma/ColorFAQ.html#RTFToC9

Coefficients for different colour spaces:
 https://hsto.org/getpro/habr/post_images/2ab/69d/084/2ab69d084f9a597e032624bcd74d57a7.png

Luminance range reference:
 https://cycling74.com/2007/05/23/your-first-shader/#.Vty9FfkrL4Z

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new luminosity material.

params.name: colorOutput
params.description: Defines whether the shader should output colours scaled with their luminance value.

params.name: luminanceRange
params.description: If provided, the shader will mask out texels that aren't in the specified luminance range.

name: setColorOutputEnabled
description: Enables or disables color output.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether color output should be enabled.

name: setLuminanceRangeEnabled
description: Enables or disables the luminance mask.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the luminance mask should be enabled.

OutlineBlendMaterial
description: An outline blend shader material.

params.name: options.patternScale
params.description: The scale of the pattern texture.

params.name: options.visibleEdgeColor
params.description: The color of visible edges.

params.name: options.hiddenEdgeColor
params.description: The color of hidden edges.

params.name: alphaBlending
params.description: Whether the outline should be blended using alpha.

params.name: xRay
params.description: Whether hidden parts of selected objects should be visible.

name: setAlphaBlendingEnabled
description: Enables or disables the alpha blending.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the alpha blending should be enabled.

name: setXRayEnabled
description: Defines whether hidden parts of selected objects should be visible.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether hidden parts of selected objects should be visible.

name: setPatternTexture
description: Sets a pattern texture to use as overlay.

params.name: texture
params.description: A pattern texture. Set to null to disable the pattern.

params.name: options.pentagon

name: setOrthogonalSearchSteps
description:
Sets the maximum amount of steps performed in the horizontal/vertical
pattern searches, at each side of the pixel.

In number of pixels, it's actually the double. So the maximum line length
perfectly handled by, for example 16, is 64 (perfectly means that longer
lines won't look as good, but are still antialiased).

params.name: steps
params.description: The search steps. Range: [0, 112].

name: src/materials/ToneMappingMaterial.js
ToneMappingMaterial

This material supports dithering.

Reference:
 http://www.cis.rit.edu/people/faculty/ferwerda/publications/sig02_paper.pdf

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new tone mapping material.

convolution approach.

name: src/passes/Pass.js
Pass
description:
An abstract pass.

Passes that do not rely on the depth buffer should explicitly disable the
depth test and depth write in their respective shader materials.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new pass.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of this pass.

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to render.

params.name: camera
params.description: The camera.

params.name: quad
params.description: A quad that fills the screen to render 2D filter effects. Set this to null, if you don't need it (see {@link RenderPass}).

name: name
description: The name of this pass.

name: scene
description: The scene to render.

name: camera
description: The camera.

name: quad
description: A quad mesh that fills the screen.

name: renderToScreen
description: Indicates whether this pass should render to screen.

name: enabled
description: Indicates whether this pass should be executed.

name: needsSwap
description:
Indicates whether the {@link EffectComposer} should swap the frame
buffers after this pass has finished rendering.

Set this to `false` if this pass doesn't render to the output buffer or
the screen. Otherwise, the contents of the input buffer will be lost.

name: material
description: The fullscreen material.

name: material
description:
Sets the fullscreen material.

The material will be assigned to the quad mesh that fills the screen.

name: render
description:
Renders the effect.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer.

params.name: inputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: outputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that serves as the output render target unless this pass renders to screen.

params.name: delta
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

params.name: stencilTest
params.description: Indicates whether a stencil mask is active.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: setSize
description:
Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

You may override this method in case you want to be informed about the main
render size.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method before this pass is
initialized and every time its own size is updated.

params.name: width
params.description: The renderer's width.

params.name: height
params.description: The renderer's height.

name: initialize
description:
Performs initialization tasks.

By overriding this method you gain access to the renderer. You'll also be
able to configure your custom render targets to use the appropriate format
(RGB or RGBA).

The provided renderer can be used to warm up special off-screen render
targets by performing a preliminary render operation.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when this pass is added to its
queue, but not before its size has been set.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: dispose
description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and
deletes them. The pass will be inoperative after this method was called!

Disposable objects:
 - render targets
 - materials
 - textures

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when it is being destroyed.
You may, however, use it independently to free memory when you are certain
that you don't need this pass anymore.

name: src/passes/RealisticBokehPass.js
RealisticBokehPass

An advanced Depth of Field (DoF) pass.

Yields more realistic results but is also more demanding.

This pass requires a {@link EffectComposer#depthTexture}.

for further processing.

description: A clear pass.

description: Indicates whether the depth buffer should be cleared explicitly.

name: clear
description:
Indicates whether the color, depth and stencil buffers should be cleared.

Even with clear set to true you can prevent specific buffers from being
cleared by setting either the autoClearColor, autoClearStencil or
autoClearDepth properties of the renderer to false.

Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing (SMAA) v2.8.

Preset: SMAA 1x Medium (with color edge detection).
 https://github.com/iryoku/smaa/releases/tag/v2.8

name: constructor

params.name: searchImage
params.description: The SMAA search image. Preload this image using the {@link searchImageDataURL}.

params.description: The SMAA area image. Preload this image using the {@link areaImageDataURL}.

name: searchImageDataURL
description:
The SMAA search image, encoded as a base64 data URL.

Use this image data to create an Image instance and use it together with
the area image to create an SMAAPass.

name: areaImageDataURL
description:
The SMAA area image, encoded as a base64 data URL.

Use this image data to create an Image instance and use it together with
the search image to create an SMAAPass.

name: opacityDestination
description:
The opacity of the input buffer.

The destination color is the color from the image in the input buffer.

The opacity of the texture.

The source color is the color from the texture.

name: src/passes/ToneMappingPass.js
ToneMappingPass
description:
A tone mapping pass that supports adaptive luminosity.

If adaptivity is enabled, this pass generates a texture that represents the
luminosity of the current scene and adjusts it over time to simulate the
optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.

Reference:
 GDC2007 - Wolfgang Engel, Post-Processing Pipeline
 http://perso.univ-lyon1.fr/jean-claude.iehl/Public/educ/GAMA/2007/gdc07/Post-Processing_Pipeline.pdf

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new tone mapping pass.

params.name: options
params.description: The options.

params.name: options.adaptive
params.description: Whether the tone mapping should use an adaptive luminance map.

params.name: options.resolution
params.description: The render texture resolution.

params.name: options.distinction
params.description: A luminance distinction factor.

name: renderTargetLuminosity
description: The render target for the current luminosity.

name: renderTargetAdapted
description: The render target for adapted luminosity.

name: renderTargetPrevious
description: A render target that holds a copy of the adapted limonosity.

name: copyMaterial
description: Copy shader material used for saving the luminance map.

name: luminosityMaterial
description: A luminosity shader material.

name: adaptiveLuminosityMaterial
description: An adaptive luminance shader material.

name: toneMappingMaterial
description: A tone mapping shader material.

name: resolution
description: The resolution of the render targets.

name: resolution
description: The resolution of the render targets. Must be a power of two for mipmaps.

name: adaptive
description: Whether this pass uses adaptive luminosity.

name: adaptive
description: Whether this pass should use adaptive luminosity.

name: dithering
description: Indicates whether dithering is enabled.

name: dithering
description: If enabled, the result will be dithered to remove banding artifacts.

name: render
description: Renders the effect.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer.

params.name: inputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: outputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that serves as the output render target unless this pass renders to screen.

params.name: delta
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

params.name: stencilTest
params.description: Indicates whether a stencil mask is active.

name: initialize
description: Performs initialization tasks.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
	"name": "postprocessing",
	"version": "4.5.0",
	"description": "A post processing library that provides the means to implement image filter effects for three.js.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/vanruesc/postprocessing",
	"main": "build/postprocessing.js",
	"module": "src/index.js",
	"license": "Zlib",

	"keywords": [
		"2d",
		"3d",
		"rendering",
		"filter",
		"effect",
		"composer",
		"gpgpu",
		"rendertexture",
		"rendertarget"
	],

	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rüschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},

	"repository": {
		"type": "git",
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/postprocessing.git"
	},

	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/postprocessing/issues"
	},

	"files": [
		"src",
		"build"
	],

	"scripts": {
		"test": "grunt --production",
		"prepack": "grunt prepublish",
		"postpublish": "grunt postpublish"
	},

	"engines": {
		"node": ">=4.0.0",
		"npm": ">=5.0.0"
	},

	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "delta"
	},

	"peerDependencies": {
		"three": ">= 0.89.0 <= 0.92.0"
	},

	"devDependencies": {
		"babel-core": "6.x.x",
		"babel-plugin-external-helpers": "6.x.x",
		"babel-preset-env": "1.x.x",
		"delta-controls": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint-config-delta": "0.x.x",
		"grunt": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-cli": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-contrib-clean": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-contrib-copy": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-contrib-nodeunit": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-contrib-uglify": "3.x.x",
		"grunt-eslint": "20.x.x",
		"grunt-inline-import": "0.x.x",
		"grunt-plugin-esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"grunt-rollup": "9.x.x",
		"jit-grunt": "0.x.x",
		"load-grunt-config": "0.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel": "3.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "3.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-string": "2.x.x",
		"three-demo": "1.x.x",
		"three": "0.92.x",
		"time-grunt": "1.x.x"
	}
}
name: package.json
